page.title: 11BOURNE WELLHEAD
page.content: The{landscape}between South and West Roads includes the{Memorial Gardens. } This garden of remembrance, with the town{War Memorial}as its central feature, is a pleasant place for quiet relaxation. Behind the Memorial Gardens is the Wellhead Field and its spring-fed pool, known as St.Peter's Pool, which flows through the town. This once powered three water mills of which only Baldock's Mill remains, although now lacking its water wheel. The{Wellhead}is also the site of{ {Bourne Castle,}the only evidence of which remains now is the grass-covered ditches about the field. The castle once stood on the{Wellhead}and was probably built by{Hereward The Wake.}
